question: Are shops and bakeries merchant or non-market?

How many digits does the Siren number have?
Concurrent management occurs when
answers: The agreement and presence of both spouses is necessary to administer common property
Only a spouse has the power to administer his or her own property
Each spouse has the power to administer a common property alone
correctAnswer: Each spouse has the power to administer a common property alone

question: In principle, acts of disposal relating to furniture are subject to:
Which of these assertions, relating to the withdrawal and transfer of powers of a spouse over joint property (Article 1426 CCiv), is false?
answers: The act performed by the authorized spouse is not enforceable against the spouse in possession
The competent judge is the family judge
The act performed by the authorized spouse binds only the latter
The spouse deprived of his powers over the common property no longer commits these funds
correctAnswer: The act performed by the authorized spouse is not enforceable against the spouse in possession

question: An act is said to be connective between spouses when
answers: It creates obligations towards both spouses
It was signed by both spouses
correctAnswer: It was signed by both spouses

question: Does a donation of a spouse's earnings and wages escape co-determination?
answers: Yes, but only if they are not saved
correctAnswer: Yes, but only if they are not saved

question: In principle, can a spouse who decides to enter into an act subject to co-determination simply warn his or her spouse to make the act valid with regard to both spouses?
answers: No, it requires express consent of both spouses
No, it requires the express or implied consent of both spouses
Yes, a simple warning is enough
correctAnswer: No, you need express or implied consent from both spouses

question: Can the donation of furniture escape co-determination?
answers: Yes, thanks to the presumption of movable property governed by Article 222 CCiv
No, any donation of furniture or buildings is subject to co-management
correctAnswer: Yes, thanks to the presumption of movable property governed by Article 222 CCiv

question: What is the process of analyzing data to make informed marketing decisions called?

Question: Paul wants to make a legacy of a common good: he promises his wife Catherine that his legacy will not exceed his share in the community. Is he within his rights?
answers: No, it is forbidden to bequeath a common goodNo, it is forbidden to bequeath a common good

question: Which leases are subject to co-determination?
answers: Commercial leases, rural leases, and residential leases relating to family housing
Rural leases and all residential leases
correctAnswer: Commercial leases, rural leases, and residential leases relating to family housing

question: In the context of an express mandate between spouses, must the mandatary spouse account for the fruits he has received from the other person's own property?
answers: No, unless the mandate expressly requires it to do so
correctAnswer: No, unless the mandate expressly requires it to do so

question: An act of disposition made by a spouse over the personal property of his spouse, without a mandate, is not enforceable against the latter.?
answers: No, it is null and void
correctAnswer: No, it is null and void

question: As part of a withdrawal of power, Fabrice was authorized to administer the property of his wife Pauline.Can he still receive the fruits?
answers: Yes, but only after joint agreement of the notary and the judge
Yes, but only with Pauline's agreement

question: Can a spouse consent to a donation of earnings and wages to his adulterous concubine, if these sums have not been saved?
answers: Yes, but only if he has fulfilled the duties of the marriage
correctAnswer: Yes, but only if he has fulfilled the obligations of the marriage

question: Should the third party who received Lucie's property, by his deed of sale, return the property received, even though it is in good faith?
answers: No, only the third party in bad faith is obliged to return the property or its value
correctAnswer: No, only the third party in bad faith is obliged to return the property or its value
